docs.lead_paragraph: Dozens of sled-dog teams glided through the frigid streets of Anchorage on Saturday in the ceremonial start to the Iditarod, a nearly 1,000-mile (1,610-km) sled dog race across the Alaskan wilderness and one of the world's most celebrated tests of endurance.

headline.print_headline: Anchorage Cheers Dog Sled Teams in Ceremonial Start of Alaska's Iditarod
headline.main: Anchorage Cheers Dog Sled Teams in Ceremonial Start of Alaska's Iditarod

docs.lead_paragraph: Joey Votto fielded grounders over and over again until most of the Cincinnati Reds were long gone, off to a spring game, weights, or just the rest of the day. He threw home. He threw to second. He practiced underhand tosses to first, backhands, everything.

docs.lead_paragraph: Canada will not tighten its border to deter migrants crossing illegally from the United States in the wake of a U.S. immigration crackdown because the numbers are not big enough to cause alarm, a government minister said on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Canada: No Plans to Clamp Down at Border to Deter Migrants

docs.lead_paragraph: Staffan de Mistura, the top United Nations diplomat working to resolve the civil war in Syria, which is about to enter its seventh year, reported some progress on Friday after nearly 10 days of talks in Geneva.
